thread.title: Spoiler alert: Downton Abbey ending revealed after giveaway prop is left behind on location
thread.title_full: Spoiler alert: Downton Abbey ending revealed after giveaway prop is left behind on location

title: Spoiler alert: Downton Abbey ending revealed after giveaway prop is left behind on location
text:
Spoiler alert: Downton Abbey ending revealed after giveaway prop is left behind on location Spoiler alert: Downton Abbey ending revealed after giveaway prop is left behind on location 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Look away now if you don’t want to know the ending of Downton Abbey: a key prop was left behind in a church after filming, leaking a major spoiler about how the series will wrap up. 
A detailed wedding order of service was discovered by a member of the public after it was left lying around in an Oxfordshire church regularly used for filming of the ITV period drama. Laura Carmichael as Lady Edith in Downton Abbey (Nick Briggs/ITV) 
According to The Mirror, the pamphlet reveals that Lady Edith Crawley, played by Laura Carmichael, is due to get hitched to a man called Herbert. 
This could refer to Bertie Pelham, who appeared in the Christmas special, asking Edith for a dance. Harry Hadden-Paton as Bertie Pelham in Downton Abbey (Nick Briggs/ITV) 
Played by Harry Hadden-Paton, he is the agent of Brancaster Castle in Northumberland, and the third cousin of Lord Hexam. Share article 
Harry is due to make an appearance in Sunday’s episode. Promoted Stories
